intro: Hawkesiophyton panamense, commonly known as the Panamanian hawkesiophyton, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Arecaceae, which includes palms, and is characterized by its slender, unbranched stem. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences with yellowish flowers, which are typically pollinated by insects. Its leaves are long and pinnately compound, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
